docs.doc: Epic 2 Story #4: Delete Account - Archive or remove unused accounts with transaction handling. Success criteria includes safe deletion with data integrity and support for 10+ accounts.
Archive/delete accounts (soft delete with transaction preservation). Users can remove unused accounts while maintaining full transaction history for audit purposes.
Audit Trail: Soft deletes maintain transaction history for auditing. Data durability and zero data loss through proper soft delete implementation.
Accounts table supports soft deletes with isDeleted flag. Design principle: Soft Deletes preserve audit trail for accounts. All data scoped by userId with supporting indexes.
Established pattern for account selection using accountSelector.ts utility. Displays numbered list with inline keyboard for multi-account scenarios. Includes cancel button at every step.
Default account protection: Cannot perform certain operations on default account without reassignment. Shows â­ indicator for default account in all lists.

constraints.constraint: Soft Delete Pattern: NEVER hard delete accounts. Always use isDeleted flag to preserve referential integrity and audit trail.
Transaction Preservation: Zero cascade delete. Transactions are sacred and must never be deleted when account is deleted.
Multi-Layer Validation: Pre-deletion validation runs before confirmation UI. Mutation-level validation ensures data integrity at database layer.
Last Account Protection: Users must always have at least one active account. Prevent deletion of only remaining account.
Default Account Protection: Cannot delete default account until another account is set as default.
Audit Trail: Update deletedAt timestamp and isDeleted flag. Maintain createdAt and updatedAt for audit purposes.
Balance Integrity: Individual account balances remain unchanged for historical accuracy. Only total balance calculations exclude deleted accounts.
Complete delete flow must execute in < 4 seconds end-to-end (intent detection â†’ confirmation â†’ deletion â†’ response).
Critical test cases: soft delete verification, last account protection, default account protection, transaction preservation, balance calculations, deleted account filtering.
Cancel Anytime: User can cancel at any step (account selection, confirmation) with no side effects until final confirmation.
Bilingual Support: All messages, warnings, and confirmations must be available in both Arabic and English with equivalent quality.

tests.standards: Testing framework: Vitest with TypeScript support. Unit tests for business logic, integration tests for end-to-end flows. Test files colocated with source files (*.test.ts). Mocking strategy: Mock Convex context and database operations. Coverage target: 80%+ for critical paths (soft delete, validation, filtering).
tests.locations: - convex/accounts/*.test.ts (account mutations and queries) - convex/commands/*.test.ts (command handlers) - convex/lib/*.test.ts (utility functions) - tests/e2e/ (end-to-end Playwright tests)

test.desc: Verify soft delete marks account as deleted without removing from database. Verify transactions remain intact and accessible.
Test last account protection: attempt to delete only remaining account should fail with specific error message.
Test default account protection: attempt to delete default account should fail until another account is set as default.
Verify transaction preservation: create account with transactions, delete account, verify transactions still queryable with deleted indicator.
Verify deleted accounts filtered from list queries and balance calculations. Test includeDeleted parameter.
Test confirmation message generation with balance warning and transaction count.
Test cancel flow at each step: account selection cancel, confirmation cancel. Verify no side effects.
Test intent detection with various Arabic and English phrasings. Test regex fallback when RORK fails.
Performance test: measure end-to-end delete flow execution time, ensure < 4 seconds.
Test account selection scenarios: zero accounts (error), single account (auto-select with validation), multiple accounts (numbered list).
